# Copilot instructions — public_tools

Purpose
- Help AI agents make focused, safe edits in this small static site project.

Big picture
- This is a static frontend: `index.html` serves the page, `main.js` contains DOM-driven logic using Chart.js (CDN v4.5.1). There is no server-side app.
- Styles are generated by Tailwind: `input.css` -> `styles.css` via the local `tailwindcss` binary (folder `tailwindcss`) or `npx tailwindcss`.

Key files to inspect
- `index.html` — page structure, includes Chart.js CDN and `main.js`, expects `styles.css`.
- `main.js` — form handling, builds data array, instantiates Chart.js on `#scenarioChart`; mutate DOM IDs carefully (`chart-form`, `scenarioChart`).
- `input.css` / `styles.css` — source vs built CSS; do not edit `styles.css` as the source of truth.
- `tailwind.config.js` — content globs (`./index.html`, `./*.js`) and custom colors (e.g. `navyblue`, `navyblue-100`..).
- `package.json` — minimal; no build scripts currently (devDependency `tailwindcss` present).
- `README` — authoritative Tailwind rebuild command (copied below).

Build & common workflows
- Rebuild Tailwind CSS exactly as documented in `README`:

  ./tailwindcss \
    -i input.css \
    -o styles.css \
    --minify

- If you prefer npm tooling, add a script in `package.json` (example):

  "scripts": {
    "build:css": "npx tailwindcss -i input.css -o styles.css --minify"
  }

- The site runs as static files — open `index.html` in a browser or serve with a static server. There are no tests, so changes should be validated manually in-browser.

Project conventions & patterns
- Tailwind-driven styling: prefer editing `input.css` or `tailwind.config.js` rather than `styles.css` (build output).
- `tailwind.config.js` content array includes `./*.js` — adding new JS files may require updating the config to ensure classes used in JS are included.
- JavaScript is vanilla DOM-manipulating code (no frameworks). Keep changes simple: update `main.js` event listeners and Chart.js config in-place.

Integration points & external deps
- Chart.js is included via CDN in `index.html` (currently v4.5.1). If upgrading, smoke-test charts for breaking changes.
- Tailwind binary lives in the repository (`tailwindcss`); the repo also lists `tailwindcss` in `devDependencies`.

Editing guidance & examples
- If you change Tailwind config colors, run the rebuild command and verify `styles.css` changes before committing.
- Example: to add a color use `tailwind.config.js` (see the existing `navyblue` block) then run the rebuild command.
- If you add an npm build step, update `package.json` scripts and mention it in `README`.

What NOT to do
- Do not edit `styles.css` directly as the canonical source — it is generated.
- Do not change the Chart.js CDN version without running the page and validating charts.

If something's unclear
- Ask for the preferred build approach (use repo binary vs `npx`) and whether CI should run the Tailwind build. Include browser test results for Chart.js upgrades.

— end
